Privacy Policy. (Optional) Cancel Registration Contact OMRON Customer Service Measurements Home Medication OMRON OMRON Viso Service is a remote patient monitoring program to enable your doctor to stay up-to-date on your health. Have an account already? Create Account About Terms Please carefully review our latest Terms of Use and Privacy Policy. I agree to the I agree to Omron anonymising my health data, and using this data, which is not traceable back to me, to improve OMRON Viso and other Omron services as described in Omron’s Privacy Policy. (Optional) I agree to Omron anonymising my health data, and using this data, which is not traceable back to me, to improve OMRON Viso and other Omron services as described in Omron’s I consent to receive promotional communications from OMRON HEALTHCARE Co., Ltd. about products and services of interest to me based on my app usage and preference. I can opt out of these communications at any time. Please enter your contact information

Note: Email address and phone number must match those registered with your GP Practice. Password must contain at least 8 characters. Please create your password. Country code (required) e.g. 44 for United Kingdom. Search Country Please fill in the SMS verification code. Verification code sent by SMS 

If you did not receive the SMS, please tap on """Resend SMS""". Congratulations! Your account has been created. First, let's learn more about OMRON Viso Sign in Reset password Please fill in your email address and a link to reset your password will be sent to you. Welcome to
OMRON Platform. Let's watch a video and learn more about OMRON Platform. What is
Hypertension Programme? OMRON Platform's Hypertension Programme helps you manage your blood pressure and reach your target blood pressure. What is 
a Monitoring Programme? OMRON Platform's Monitoring Programmes assists you in measuring your vital signs and sends this information to your doctor for follow-up. Let's explore
Hypertension Plus User not found The email address and phone number that you entered do not match our records.

To use OMRON Viso you must be invited by a Healthcare Professional.

If you have received an invite but are not able to register please try again, and if you continue to see this message please contact your GP Practice to confirm your contact details. User is existing The email address and phone number that you entered has already existed. You can use the email address to login to this application directly. If you forgot your password, please click 'reset password'. We have the following information on file. If this is information is correct, tap on Send SMS to complete verification of your account

Not you? Tap on 'Cancel Registration' and contact your GP Practice First name Other name(s) Family name %s Data synchronisation Your Recorded data is being synchronised. Programmes Programmes You Have Been Enrolled in Your GP has enrolled you in the programme(s) listed below. Please check that they are correct. On the next few screens, you will be able to watch a few videos about OMRON Platform and how your programmes help you. Reauthentication Method To keep your health data secure, please set up a re-authentication method which can be used to confirm your identity when you re-open Viso, or after 30 minutes of inactivity. If you do not set up a quick re-authentication method, you will be asked to re-login to Viso each time. Face Authentication Fingerprint Iris PIN Code Important: You should not turn on fingerprint recognition if anyone else has their fingerprints registered on this device. Use fingerprint to re-authenticate PIN CODE Please enter your 6-digit PIN code. Once again, please enter your 6-digit PIN code. The Passcodes do not match. Please try again. Set-up complete A quick reauthentication method has been set-up, which will be used to re-login to Viso each time. Error The setting of your %s have been changed. This option has been disabled on Viso. Please proceed to login with your email and password. You can enable %s again from the Menu > Reauthentication page. Hypertension Heart Failure Selected Index Monitoring Home Information This is your home screen.
Tap on ⓘ to take a tour. On the Home tab, you will find tasks that your health care provider would like you to do. Once you have completed a task, it will be moved to the bottom of the list. The home banner dynamically highlights important information, your upcoming tasks, and your task completion rate. You can tap the banner for more information. This is an example of a measurement task. You will be asked to take certain measurements according to the frequency your health care provider has set for you. This is a medication task.
Tap on the grey circle to mark medication as taken For some programmes, you may be asked how you feel daily. Please answer this question based solely on your physical condition. In the Menu, you can find various settings options, such as your profile, reminder settings, and other helpful information. In the settings tab, you can set the time for blood pressure and medication action alerts During your measurement week you measure your blood pressure in the morning and evening.

The 4 status bar keeps you up-to-date on your progress. Starting Measurement Week in %s days. Let's add your first blood pressure reading for your measurement week.
Tap on the 'Add BP' button to get started! Let's set your personal medication schedule.
Tap on 'Update' to get started! Measurements Tab Information Click on ⓘ to learn how to use the blood pressure screen. On the Blood Pressure tab, you can view and enter your blood pressure readings. The calendar shows which days you have recorded your blood pressure.

Days highlighted with a blue background are part of your measurement week, you should take your blood pressure in the morning and evening on these days You can switch the calendar between week and month view. Tap on any day in the calendar to view your blood pressure record or enter past results. Tap on the chart icon to see a graph of your blood pressure results. Use the add button at the bottom to add a new measurement for that day. Your blood pressure results graph can be viewed in ‘week’, ‘month’ or ‘year’ mode. Medication Information Tap on ⓘ to explore the medication tab On your Medication tab, you can see your scheduled medication if you are on a medication plan. The calendar shows which days you have marked your medication as taken. Tap on any day in the calendar to view your medication diary or mark past medication as taken. Tap on the tick box to mark medication as taken for the selected day. Tap here to check your list of medications. You can also access this list easily from the Menu options. Your personalised medication plan is displayed here. Let's complete today's tasks together, %s! Let's complete today's tasks together! Select Range Take Medication Measure blood pressure Add Measurement Week Please complete at least 8 blood pressure tasks this week. Completed Tasks [%d] Tell your clinician how are you doing Complete Questionnaire SYS DIA Pulse Next Measurement Week : Will Start on %s Unfortunately you did not complete the required measurement recordings. Starting in %s days Starting in %s day What is the Measurement Week?
During your measurement week you measure your blood pressure in the morning and the evening every day

What happens with the data?
Taking measurements over 1 week gives an accurate picture of your blood pressure. Your doctor uses this to review your treatment plan.

Want to learn more?
Tap here to learn more from the NHS about home blood pressure monitoring

Remember: 
Always follow your doctor's advice, and if you have questions or concerns, contact them in your usual way. What is a Measurement Week? Measurement Week is
in progress Measurement Week Results %s-%s Ave. SYS Ave. DIA Above target Below target Great job! Your blood pressure is within your target. What happens now? Keep up the good work! Keep following your clinician's advice and keep your blood pressure within your target. Want to learn more? %s to learn more about blood pressure targets from the NHS. Next Step: Rejected Accepted Questionnaire Answering these questions truthfully will help make sure that you have the right treatment plan for you Medication How often do you forget to take your medication? How many days in the past week have you forgotten to take your medication as prescribed? I am not on medication Every time Most of the time Some of the time Hardly ever Symptoms I have been experiencing the following symptoms / side effects: Fever Dizziness Headache Diarrhea Cough Weakness Rash Constipation Is there anything that may have impacted your blood pressure this month? Activity In the past month I have been active (walking, running or other doing other sports): Less than 30 minutes per day 30 to 60 minutes per day Please contact your GP Surgery as soon as possible to discuss your blood pressure reading.

A new task, “Contact GP office” has been added to your task list. This task will remain in your task list until completed.

After tapping 'confirm' you will no longer be able to edit your response. Lifestyle Compared to last month I have done/had more, less or similar amounts of Salt Alcohol Healthy Eating Smoking Sleep Activity None Less Similar More Confirm Submission You will not be able to edit your responses after confirmation Your Treatment Plan Target Home Blood Pressure Your average blood pressure in the last measurement week was above your target. What happens now? Moving to the next step in your medication plan can help you to achieve blood pressure control. Current：%s Next：%s %s/%s mmHg %s has recommended that you move to the next step in your medication plan. 

 Why should i move to the next step?
 In your last measurement week your blood pressure was %s mmHg. %s has set a home blood pressure target for you of 135/85 mmHg.

 Is it normal to change medication dose?
It can take time to find the right medication dose, and it's normal to go through a trial period to find out which medications work best for you personally. 

Moving to the next step in your plan is a natural part of the process to help you best manage your blood pressure. 

What happens if I don't agree?
If you decide to reject the next medication step we recommend to contact your doctor to discuss your needs. Reason for rejection Please help your clinician to understand why you are rejecting the next step Add your Feedback(Required) Continue Current Treatment Plan You have chosen not to proceed to the next medication step 

What Next?
Your clinician has received your message and might get in touch with you. In the meantime please continue on your current treatment plan. Your choice will be communicated to your clinician.

Please continue with your current medication until your new medication is available, or unless instructed differently by your clinician.

When your clinician has created your new prescription you will receive a new task in Hypertension Plus: "Update Medication Schedule", to set up reminders for your new medication.

 Completing the task confirms to your clinician that you have started your new medication.

Please make sure that you have your new medication before updating your medication schedule. %s has reviewed your medication plan and recommended a change in your plan. Message from your clinician: Current medication Next medication If you accept the plan, you will move to the %s. Next Step You have reached the end of your current medication plan. 

What now?
Your clinician has reviewed your medication and recommended a new plan. Update medication schedule Please confirm that the medication you have received is the same as in your medication plan, then tap ‘Next‘. Contact your GP Practice if it is not the same. Tap ‘Later‘ to save this action for later. Current medication Next medication Your medication schedule has been updated. Why do I need to update my medication schedule? I confirm that I have my new medication and it is the same as in the new plan shown above. Contact Your GP Surgery Message from your clinician: %s Your latest blood pressure measurement has exceeded %s Systolic/%s Diastolic. Please contact your GP surgery or out-of-hours service as soon as possible. Your latest blood pressure measurement was lower than %s Systolic.

Please contact your GP surgery or out-of-hours service as soon as possible. Your GP Surgery The name of the hospital Phone Number (%s - %s) Phone Number - Phone Number (Out of Hours) %s Test Request Please schedule a %s test Fill in the date that you plan to do the Blood/Urine test to receive a reminder on the day. Fill in the date of your scheduled %s test to receive a reminder on the day of the test. Heart Failure I will plan the test later I have planned when I will do the test Schedule %s Test %s test reminder Your GP would like to enrol you in the %s programme. After joining the programme, you will be asked to measure your blood pressure and weight according to your GP instructions, on top of the measurements required from your existing programmes.

Please acknowledge that you are aware of and have agreed to joining this programme by tapping the "OK" button and continue with the enrolment. If you do not wish to join the programme, or have any questions, please contact your GP to discuss your concerns. What is
a %s? OMRON Platform's Monitoring Programmes assists you in measuring your vital signs and sends this information to your doctor for follow up. Reminder Setting Programme Terminated Edit blood/urine test reminder Your GP has removed you from the %s programme. Please acknowledge the programme termination by tapping the “OK” button below. Your task lists will be updated after that. If you have any questions about the termination, please contact your GP to discuss them. Medication Change Tap here to learn more about why you need a new medication plan. Why do I need a new medication plan? As with all medications, there is a possibility of side-effects with anti-hypertensive medications.

Before you accept the new plan, read more to understand side-effects with your new medication below. About Medication(s) Your choice will be communicated to your clinician to your GP who will write you a prescription.

After you get the new prescription, pick up your medication from the pharmacy as soon as possible. You will also receive a new task: Update Medication Schedule. Complete the task to let your GP know when you’re starting on your new medication. You will also be able to update your medication reminders to match your new schedule.

In the meantime, continue with your current treatment plan. GP Surgery Local Clinic Local Hospital as soon as possible %s after the start of your new medication %s Location of test: %s Required tests: Please arrange for the test %s Blood Urine Blood and Urine %d day %d days Test instructions: %s Your clinician has confirmed your test result.
Click on the Schedule %s test to start updating your test day Measurements Select Vital Weight Atrial Fibrillation Add Pulse Add Weight Blood Pressure Monitor SpO2 Blood Pressure Week Month Completed Tasks Measured Measurement Week Today Time SYS/DIA Pulse Weight Add Blood Pressure Add Pulse Add Weight Blood Pressure Graph Week Month Year SYS Target DIA Target Date SYS/DIA Pulse Add Blood Pressure Taking an Accurate Blood Pressure Measurement 2 readings - You will be asked for 2 readings.
-Take them at least 1 minutes apart.
-Average blood pressure will be shared with your GP. For more tips on taking an accurate measurement tap on 'learn more'. Taking an Accurate Blood Pressure Measurement How to Take an Accurate Weight Measurement You can view this video again from Menu > Help/Videos page. Don't show this again First measurement result Second measurement result Extra Measurement Needed Enter your readings and check that you have entered the time of measurement and values correctly. Date Time SYS DIA Pulse Please wait 1 minute, measure your blood pressure again and then enter the results here. Measurement Results Your blood pressure is higher than your target of less than %s mmHg Systolic and %s mmHg diastolic.

Please keep monitoring your blood pressure, and keep up those healthy habits so that you can reach your target! 

Your blood pressure is within your target of less than %s mmHg Systolic and %s mmHg diastolic. 

Please keep monitoring your blood pressure, and keep up those healthy habits so that you stay within your target! Your blood pressure is high today.

On the next screen we will ask you to complete a short questionnaire about your health. Your blood pressure is very low today. 

On the next screen we will ask you to complete a short questionnaire about your health. Your blood pressure is high today. Your blood pressure is very low today. Blood pressure results are shared with your clinician but may not be actively reviewed outside of your measurement week.

If you have any concerns about your blood pressure please contact your GP surgery in the normal way. Questionnaire Answering these questions truthfully helps your doctor to support you best with your treatment plan. Medication Have you taken your medication today? Yes No How often have you taken your medication in the past month? Every day 5 to 6 times per week 1 to 4 times per week Less than 1 time per week Symptoms Are you experiencing the following symptoms, or any other symptoms? 

If so, please contact your GP practice or call 111 (out-of-hours) immediately to report your symptoms.

If you feel able, please complete this short questionnaire. Confusion Drowsiness Changed/Blurred vision Nausea/Vomiting Central Chest Pain/Pressure Difficulty Breathing/Shortness of Breath Dizziness Severe Headache Numbness or Weakness in Face, Arm or Leg Is there anything that may have impacted your blood pressure this month? Enter other symptoms not found in the list. Confirm Submission Please contact your GP Surgery as soon as possible to discuss your blood pressure reading.

A new task, “Contact GP office” has been added to your task list. This task will remain in your task list until completed.

After tapping 'confirm' you will no longer be able to edit your response. You will be requested to fill in this questionnaire whenever your blood pressure measurements are higher than normal or too low. 

Answering these questions truthfully helps to make sure you have the best treatment plan for you. After tapping ‘confirm’ you will no longer be able to edit your response. Delete Record Are you sure you want to delete this record?

Your clinician uses your blood pressure readings to set and review your treatment plan.

If you have entered the reading incorrectly, please delete this record and re-enter the correct values. This index is no longer monitored by your doctor. You can add measurements for your own record. Medication List Week Month Medication Taken Not Taken Today Taken Medication List Hypertension Other Medication Current medication If my blood pressure is too high, my clinician may ask me to increase my medication. Next medication Take Medication Hypertension Treatment Plan What is my Medication Plan? Your personal medication plan has been created for you by your doctor and will normally start with 3 steps.

Managing blood pressure with a step-wise plan has been proven in clinical trials to be safe and effective.

If you have been taking your medication for a while and your blood pressure is still high during your blood pressure measurement week, your doctor may ask you to move to the next step in your plan.

It can take a number of steps to reach your blood pressure target. If you reach the end of this plan and your blood pressure is not yet below your target, your doctor may update the plan with new steps. What does your plan look like? People may react differently to medication, so your plan is based on your personal situation. The aim of your treatment plan is to help you to reach your blood pressure target. My target home blood pressure: Systolic %s mmHg 
 Diastolic %s mmHg Your plan has been created and approved by your clinician.

You are currently on step %s. Your plan has been created and approved by your clinician and consists of 3 steps.

Please update medication schedule to enter STEP 1. STEP%s 
 %s mg %s times per day STEP%s 
 %s mg %s times per day STEP%s 
 %s mg %s times per day Moving to the next step in your plan If your blood pressure is high in your measurement week, your clinician may ask you to move to the next step in your medication plan.

You will receive a task on your Home Screen to review and accept the next step.

When you accept the change, your clinician will create a new prescription for you.

You will receive an alert in OMRON Viso when the prescription has been created, however you must collect the prescription and medication in your usual way.

You can also choose to reject the chosen step. Your choice will be communicated to your clinician and they may contact you to discuss why you have rejected. Why do I need to update my medication schedule? When you move to the next step in your plan, your medication will change.
Once you have received your medication we update your schedule so that you always have the correct medication reminders.
To change default reminder timings go to Reminder Setting. When you move to the next step in your plan, your medication will change.
Once you have received your medication we update your schedule so that you always have the correct medication reminders.
To change default reminder timings go to Reminder Setting. What happens if I reject a medication step? If you choose not to proceed to the next step in your medication plan, your clinician may contact you to discuss your decision.

Please continue following your current medication plan, or contact your GP Practice in the normal way if you have questions about your plan. Why has a new plan been recommended? Your clinician may recommend a new plan if you reach the end of your current plan or if, for example, you have reported side-effects to medication you are using.

You always have the choice to accept or reject a new plan.

If you have any concerns you can always contact your GP Practice in the normal way. Result Incomplete Measurement Week not completed. You did not take enough measurements during your measurement week. What happens now? Your doctor needs your blood pressure data to make sure that you have the best possible treatment plan for you.
Next month we will ask you again to complete a measurement week. Tap here to learn more about blood pressure targets from the NHS. Tap here to learn more about the importance of blood pressure control from the NHS. Remember: Always follow your clinician's advice, and if you have questions or concerns, contact your GP practice in your usual way.
Your blood pressure is above your target. What happens now? Your clinician will review your results along with your monthly questionnaire and may ask you to move to the next step in your medication plan. Want to learn more? %s to learn more about blood pressure targets from the NHS. Remember: Always follow your clinician's advice, and if you have questions or concerns, contact your GP practice in your usual way.
Pulse
What is a Measurement Week? Try to measure your blood pressure every morning and evening this week. What happens if I miss a day? Don't worry, just continue measuring the next day. We will extend your measurement week by up to 7 days to allow you to catch up! What happens with the data? Your clinician uses this data to review your treatment plan. How is the timing of my next measurement week decided? If your blood pressure is under control (within the target set for you by your clinician), you may be asked to do your measurement week less frequently. 
Even if your measurement week is less frequent, we recommend to continue monitoring your blood pressure and adding it to Hypertension Plus so that you can keep track of your health. Want to learn more? Tap here to learn more about blood pressure targets from the NHS. Tap here to learn more from the NHS about home blood pressure monitoring. Remember: Always follow your clinician's advice, and if you have questions or concerns, contact your GP practice in your usual way.
During your measurement week you should measure your blood pressure in the morning and the evening every day. What happens with the data? Taking a series of measurements throughout the week gives the most accurate picture of your blood pressure.

Your blood pressure readings from your Measurement Week are used by your clinician to support decisions about your treatment. Want to learn more? %s to learn more from the NHS about home blood pressure monitoring. Remember: Always follow your clinician's advice, and if you have questions or concerns, contact your GP practice in your usual way.

// Postural Drop/Postural Hypertension Take Your Blood Pressure When Standing Always take your blood pressure when standing.

This is because your blood pressure is lower when standing compared to sitting, a condition called Postural Hypotension.

Please wait at least 2 minutes after standing to take your blood pressure, and make sure that your arm is supported.

If you accept the plan, you will be following %s Tap here to learn more about why you have received this new medication plan. Enter your feedback for doctor As with all medications, there is a possibility of side-effects with anti-hypertensive medications.

Please read and acknowledge the available information from NHS about your new medication before accepting. To accept, mark this checkbox to indicate that you understand the information about your new medication(s) Learn more about %1$s
Your next measurement week Based on the blood pressure readings that you have shared with your clinician, your next measurement week will start in %1$s.

We recommend to continue to monitor your blood pressure with Hypertension Plus between your measurement weeks to help you keep track of your health.

Why has my measurement week schedule changed?

If your blood pressure was above your target in the last measurement week, you will be asked to submit more frequent readings until you reach your blood pressure target.

If your blood pressure was within your target in the last 2 measurement weeks, you have good control of your blood pressure and will be asked to submit readings less frequently. about %d weeks about %d months Internet connection is required to view this action card. %d / %d Welcome to OMRON Viso. 
You can use OMRON Viso by logging in with your NHS login. Note : OMRON Viso can only be accessed with an invite from your doctor. If you did not receive an invite from your doctor, contact your doctor to confirm availability in your area. Let's Explore
OMRON Platform Note : OMRON Viso can only be accessed with an invite from your doctor. If you did not receive an invite from your doctor, contact your doctor to confirm availability in your area.
OMRON Viso OMRON Viso Service is a remote patient mornitoring program to enable your doctor to stay up-to-date on your health. Login with email address Based on your last measurement result we would like you to measure your blood pressure again after 5 minutes. Record your results on this screen within 20 minutes. Taking an Accurate
Blood Pressure Measurement - You will be asked for 2 readings.
- Take them at least 1 minutes apart.
- Average blood pressure will be shared with your GP. - You will be asked for 2 readings. - Take them at least 1 minute and at maximum 10 minutes apart. - Average blood pressure will be shared with your GP. Bad… How do you feel today? How are % today? Other than %, how do you feel today? Glad to hear you are doing well today! If there is any change in your condition, please call your clinician. Do you have worsening or new chest pain? Have you felt very light-headed and unsteady or even blacked out? Do you have diarrhoea or vomiting for more than 24 hrs? Do you have symptoms of an infection and/or do you feel very unwell? Have you had to increase your dose of water tablet (diuretic) in the past week? Are you feeling more breathless than usual? Or at night, do you need more pillows to sleep on? Are your legs or abdomen more swollen than before? Over the last few days, do you find yourself being less able to go around doing the usual things you do? How are your swollen legs today? Apart from your %s how are you feeling today? Please contact your GP Surgery as soon as possible to discuss your blood pressure reading.

//NHS Error To use OMRON Viso, you must be invited by a Healthcare Professional.

If you have received an invitation but are not able to log in, please contact your GP Practice to confirm your details.

You will be logged out of NHS login when you press the button below. To use OMRON Viso, you need to complete an ID check and verify your identity to a high level with NHS login.

If you have already done so, it may take a few hours for NHS login to process your ID check. You will receive a confirmation email if your ID check has been successful.

Please log in to OMRON Viso after you have received the confirmation email.

You will be logged out of NHS login when you press the button below. Welcome to OMRON Viso! Your Healthcare Provider needs to verify your registration before you can use the App. 

If you remain logged in, the App will unlock when your registration has been verified.

If you continue to see this message for a long time, try logging out and logging in again, or contact your GP Practice to confirm registration. OMRON Viso requires the use of NHS login to verify, authenticate and protect your identity. To use NHS login with OMRON Viso, you must consent to sharing your data with OMRON Viso while you are signing in with NHS login.

If you wish to proceed with OMRON Viso, please tap the button below and sign in again with NHS login. Title There is no email program associated to perform this requested action. Please install an email program and try again. Calendar Delete Welcome back! Please unlock with your biometric authentication. Unlock In order to activate this feature, go to your device's Settings > Security Use your biometrics to continue This app uses your makes use of biometric or device password/PIN to authenticate the dialog. Confirm your identity
